see  4. June stands up as MR. HEARN, fifties, paunchy, heads into glassed-in office. On his way in...

It’s true. They’re younger, smarter, better looking. So I need everyone on my staff to be on the ball, to do their jobs well, ‘cause it makes me look better than I actually am. Understand?

Good. Because, June, we're all replaceable.

You do that. He heads into his office. June looks around at the others the office, who stare. They quickly turn back to their wo embarrassed. INT. JUNE'S MOM’S APARTMENT - DAY The place is a warm and comfortable mess -- colorful, mismatched furniture, funky tchotchkes -- the opposite of June’s condo. In the midst of the clutter, JUNE’S MOM happily packs up suitcase. June bursts through the door carrying two arm- fulls of groceries.

(quickly) I’m going to be late getting back to work. I had to go to three stores to get your fiber. Remember, you've got to take it twice a day. She starts hurriedly putting the groceries away in the cabinets and fridge, then notices her mom packing.
(wary) You going somewhere?
JUNE’S’ MOM Nevada.
What for? JUNE’S MOM Burning Man.
Burning Man? The festival? JUNE’S MOM Mm-hmm. I read about it in the paper this morning, and it looks amazing. June steps between her mother and the suitcase.
Mom, you can‘t keep doing this to me. JUNE’'S MOM I’m not doing anything to you, June. I’m just living my life. Try it. It’s fun. She steps around her daughter and continues packing.

Look, just because. I don’t choose to live my life like a carny doesn’t make it any less satisfying. JUNE’S MOM Some people are perfectly happy being an assistant at Fidelity their whole lives, and that’s great. You‘’re just not one of them.

How would you know? JUNE’S MOM Because you’re my daughter. There’s got to be some of me in there somewhere -~ some little adventurous gene, dying to get out. Just try something different while I’m gone -- anything. Go skydiving. Get drunk at the zoo. (MORE )
JUNE'S MOM (cont'd) Oooh, I know! Date an exciting stranger. Try that website, Mate- dot-com. JUNE . I am not doing the internet dating thing. JUNE’S MOM
Come on, Junie. It’s not just for losers anymore.
Is that their slogan? It’s catchy. Look, I'm perfectly capable of meeting men on my own. JUNE’S MOM Sure, you meet them, you date them, but it never lasts, does it? And why's that?

Because I introduce them to you? JUNE’S MOM Because they’re everything you say you want -- dependable, straight- laced, solid career -- but you dump them anyway. Because, deep down, you know you could never have the kind of life you really want. Not with them, anyway.
You know what? I’ve got to get back to work. Enjoy Burning Man. Don’t: get arrested.
No promises. June kisses her mom's cheek and hurries out the door.

June rides up, lost in thought. INT. OFFICE - JUNE’S FLOOR - DAY dune steps off the elevator, sees a crowd of her CO-WORKE gathered around a beaming 50-SOMETHING WOMAN. Mr. Hearn leads the proceedings.

Today we celebrate Elaine Glazer and her thirty years of service to this company. Elaine, on behalf of the Fidelity family, this is for you. He hands the woman a box. She eagerly opens it and pulls a generic DESK CLOCK. She’s looks genuinely happy to get
Read the inscription.
(giddily) “Elaine: Congratulations on 30 years.” This is great. Thank you!

No, thank you! Here’s to another thirty years. Or at least fifteen. The crowd applauds and breaks up quickly, leaving June standing there uneasily. The beaming woman sets the clock down in her cubicle, the goes back to work. Business as usual. June stares, aghast.

Sparse. Spotless. June sits at the kitchen table, finishe dinner. She gets up, rinses her one plate, one glass, one fork an one knife and puts them into the drying rack. She stands there a moment, staring at the lonely place setting, then leaves the kitchen... ROMANTIC MUSIC OVER...
An explosion of lights around it. A COUPLE KISSING PASSIONATELY in f.g. WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL: The image is on A COMPUTER SCREEN. REVEAL:
June sits in bed with her laptop.
What are you waiting for?
Images of couples in various romantic locales. Restaurant Walking on beaches. Holding hands. Laughing. Toasting...

At Mate-dot-com, your life begins now. Go ahead. Take the plunge... And now we see a HANDSOME MAN dive into a remote tropical pool, swims up to an ALLURING WOMAN and kisses her. A couple ride together on a motor scooter through the cob streets of a romantic European city. Another gorgeous couple slow dance outside, at night, and PULL BACK TO REVEAL they’re doing it in front of Trevi Fountain. And finally, this incredibly tan, blond, pumped-up GUY in surf trunks walks out of the ocean carrying a lobster.
My name is Rick. I’m a Pediatric Cardiologist. I’m waiting for you on Mate-dot-com. (smiles) What are you waiting for?
Staring at the screen. She takes a breath, starts typing we...
It’s pouring rain. Inside, June sits at a table, alone.

June, dressed up, hair up, sits at a table. She’s anxious She checks her watch. She’s been sitting here a while. She looks at the menu, looks up as A MAN comes in the doo looks around. She sits up, hopeful as he walks towards he but then continues walking and joins a big GROUP in the b The MAITRE D’ approaches...
MAITRE D’ Mademoiselle, are you sure I can’t get you something while you wait? A glass of wine, perhaps?
No, thank you. The reservation was for eight o’clock, wasn’t it? MAITRE D’ Yes, ma’am. She glances at a clock that says NINE O'CLOCK. MAITRE D’ But you know-- the weather...

Oh, yeah, there was a terrible accident downtown. If I hadn’t left an hour early-- he’s probably caught in that. MAITRE D’ Yes. I’m sure of it. June sits there a moment. Feels the looks from the other diners. Before she can stop herself, she starts to cry. T Maitre D’ and a waiter look away. MAITRE D’ Bastard.

It’s RAINING as A FIGURE in an overcoat, collar pulled up hurriedly crosses the street, glancing over his shoulder. The Figure moves past the restaurant, but backs up, seein June along at her table, crying. He stands there, his bac to us, watching her. We HEAR A HELICOPTER. The Figure turns, sees A SEARCHLIGH SWEEP THE STREET. He ducks inside the restaurant.
June dabs at her eyes, picks up her purse, is about to st when...
Hello.
1l. She looks up sees the MAN IN THE OVERCOAT standing there. see him clearly for the first time. He’s suave, good- looking, Italian shoes, three thousand dollar suit.
Are you...?
June, yeah. Andrew?
Guilty. I’m so sorry. How long have you been--
--Oh, not long. That’s okay. He shakes her hand, smiles at her. She can’t believe her luck. She looks around at the other diners, many looking this way. He takes off his coat and sits.
Just so you know, this is not me. I‘m not that guy who keeps a lady waiting.
What guy are you?
Right now, a thirsty guy. He opens the wine list, studies it...

You look like a red girl to me. A big bold red... Andrew begins speaking in flawless French. She watches, dazzled as the Maitre D’ laughs at something Andrew says, then bows and moves on to fetch the wine. Andrew turns ba to her and smiles.
So.
Have you done this before?
What? Had dinner with a beautiful woman? Once or twice.
(blush) No... computer dated.
Oh... No. Can't say that I have.
Why did you pick me? S
Look at you.
But I didn’t post a picture.
No. I know, but... there was so much beauty in how you described yourself. In your words.
Really.
Plus, June was my mother’s name. This gets her smiling again. The Waiter brings the wine. Andrew nods at the wine.label when the waiter shows it to him. The Waiter then starts to open the bottle...
You had some good words yourself. It was your poem that got me.
My poem.
It was... amazing.
Please don’t make me recite it now.
That first line is so beautiful.
Roses are red--
Okay, I won’t force you.  , 13. He just smiles as the waiter pours the wine. She watches taste it like a pro, nod his approval. The waiter pours t each a glass and Andrew raises his.
What should we toast to?
Taking risks.

Good one. They touch glasses and drink, her eyes on him the whole t The girl believes she has won the lottery. Andrew glances over her shoulder as TWO LARGE MEN IN SUITS AND OVERCOATS move past the window now. He puts his hand in his pocket.
Man, it's really raining out there. June turns to look out the window and Andrew DROPS A SMAL OBJECT INTO HER PURSE. It looks like, well, a small ACTIO FIGURE. She then turns back...
Where did you learn to speak Prench?
Junior High. She looks at him. He smiles.
I learned on the job.
As a bankruptcy lawyer?
Boy, you really do read those profiles. (then) My... old job. International relations. I speak a dozen languages, and a few dialects.
Fluently?
Just enough to order a decent bottle of wine.  14. He toasts again, and again they drink. She loves it.
Very decent. So you travel a lot?
Constantly. You?
(shakes her head) Not so much. But someday I’m going to quit my job and just see the world for a couple of years.
Some day? Why wait? Boom. She looks at him.
What’s wrong with right now?
I don’t know. What is wrong with right now?
Most people live their entire lives waiting for that big thing or that big moment to come along and change everything. And you know what happens?
What?
Nothing. They spend their lives waiting. But that’s not me.
(entranced) Me neither.
You wanna know something, June? (leans closer) We're gonna be dead for a lot longer than we’re gonna be alive. Think about that.
(gone) We are, aren't we?  15.

So why wait? And with that she leans across the table and kisses him. long kiss, he looks at her, looks past her to the door wh TWO LARGE MEN IN SUITS enter the restaurant, look around. pulls away first. She looks at him,
I’m sorry, I don’t know what--
No. That was great, that was unbelievably good. I really enjoyed it, but... (pushes back) Could you excuse me for just a minute?

(embarrassed) Sure. He gets up, heads for the back of the restaurant as the t big men now move through the dining room. June sits there humiliated. Tries not to look left or right. We HOLD ON her. She'd climb into her shoe if she could. Then...
June?
Listen, I don’t know what got into me-- She stops. A GUY, soaked to the bone in a suit stands the

Who. are you?
Andrew. Munson. June now looks around the restaurant. He sits down. Sees the full wine glass in front of him.
GUY ‘ Oh. You ordered wine. I should have told you... I’m allergic to grapes...

Milner! And TWO HUGE MEN step in front of him, pointing guns at h

June jumps out, rushing to the body.
Oh my God... Are you okay?! The body COUGHS and rolls over. It’s MILNER. June stares shock as he struggles to his feet.
You?!

Milner looks up. June follows his gaze to an OVERPASS.
You jumped onto my car?
Didn’t look so high from up there... He sits up. Looks at her. Extends his hand.
John.
What?
That's my name. John Milner.
John Milner. Right. Like I’m going to believe anything you say after you lied to me.

Look, just leave me alone, alright? 4 She starts to head back for her car, but sees him struggl get up, his knees buckle and June has to grab him. ,

A mistake.
Was perfect. Who taught you to kiss like that?
(lets him drop) . You're insane. Whatever your problem is, it’s not my problem--

June pulls up to the ER and opens the back door, revealin Milner lying on the back seat. JUNE é Hello! I need some help here! TWO DOCTORS appear, -hoisting Milner onto a gurney.

BP’s dropping through the floor... June can’t help but shoot a worried peek at Milner as he disappears into the elevator.
Milner lies on the gurney in a white shirt and suit coat.
Let’s get this off him. The doctor tries to rip Milner’s shirt but it doesn’t bud It‘s made of some high-tech, rubberized material.
That's weird--. He takes out a scalpel. Milner’s eyes pop open.
Nurse Cheryl slides a clipboard across her desk:
Ma‘am, if your friend was injured during a crime--
He’s not my friend. I just made a mistake, thinking it would so easy to meet a guy--
Ma‘ am--
Like, you know, you could just hit send and all of a sudden you're not alone anymore.
Ma’ am-— JUNE . He's not my problem. He’s trouble. They're all trouble...

Honey, if you left the scene of any sort of felony or accident without telling anybody who you are, then you're gonna be in a lot of trouble. Understand? (passes her the form) So, just to be safe... June stares at the forms, makes a decision.
Fine. Whatever. I just wanna get out of here.
June walks to her car, rummages through her purse for her keys, comes up with them, her hand shaking, accidentally drops them. It’s too much...

Dammit! She finally gets in the car, and she pulls out of the ER entrance. Suddenly, A BLACK SEDAN with GOVERNMENT PLATES roars past, almost hitting her. ccc g:  2l. INT. JUNE’S CAR - NIGHT June watches them hurry inside, quickly pulls out.
Four SUITS approach Nurse Cheryl. We recognize two of the AGENTS from the restaurant. Front and center is ACKERMAN, small man with no smile, no small talk and no patience.
Special Agent Ackerman, FBI. Beside him is a BIG RED HEADED AGENT. When he speaks we s that he has BRACES on his teeth. He holds up a security camera photo of Milner:.

He was unconscious. They just took him upstairs. I’11 find out where. (dials phone, then) Nancy? Hi. This is Cheryl down in admitting. No, not Gomez. Cheryl Kublick. Cheryl G is Filipino and weighs like three hundred pounds-- Ackerman pounds his palm‘on the desk.
(to Ackerman) You want to keep that hand? Take it off my desk. Ackerman eyes her, but takes his hand off.
(into phone) Listen, where did you put the guy we sent up a few minutes ago? (then) The guy -- name’s John Milner. What? Well, check again. He should be-- .
DING! They all turn to see the elevator doors open... REVEALING both Doctors slumped on the floor. The suits draw their weapons. The escape door on the ceil is open and Milner’s gone.

Where are the stairs?
Right down that hall... (grabs the admitting form) But you should know there was a-- Ackerman’s WALKIE squeaks to life.

We got something on four. And he’s out of there. She puts the clipboard down on the counter. Fine. Whatever. INT. JUNE’S CAR - NIGHT June pulls onto the highway. She drives along, takes deep breaths, gets herself together. After a while, she laughs
The internet. Jesus. What was I thinking? Behind June, we see Milner sit up in the back seat. He ho a GUN...
Exactly, June, what were you thinking? June SCREAMS, swerving across the road. Milner waves the as he talks... .
You're lucky. I mean, you could've met someone really crazy...
I need you to pull over... She jams on the brakes, pulling over.
June jumps out of the car like it’s on fire.
What the hell is wrong with you?! Milner stumbles out behind her, waving the gun...
Me? What about you? I mean, what’s someone looks as good as you do, trolling the internet...
That’s really none of your . business.

(waving the gun) C’mon, June, I know people. I get a-- (taps his gut with th: gun) : --feeling and I’m never wrong. And I got that feeling with you, like something happened. I mean, how's it possible you don’t have a man? She doesn’t answer.
But, hey, we‘ll get to that, right now I need your help...
Help? Really? Because it kinda looks like-- (indicates the gun) --you wanna kill me.
June, I’m not trying to kill you.
How do I know that?  24.
Because you’re not dead. Listen, I borrowed some stuff from the hospital-- He reaches into an inside pocket and takes out some banda alcohol, needle and thread. June takes out her cell...
I'm calling the cops.
Good luck with that. When June presses TALK on her cell, all she hears is STAT
So how’s it work, you look for women eating by themselves... then what, get them to invest all their Money in some pyramid scheme, or do. you just kill them, make a bathrobe out of their skin?

A bathrobe out of their-- June. You looked sad. I wasn’t gonna go inside, wasn’t planning on it, but I saw you sitting there, all alone, and... well, I couldn’t help myself. She says nothing to that. Doesn’t know if he’s telling th truth or not.
I was really enjoying our dinner. And I am sorry that I. left, but I had bigger issues, like, y’know, the fate of the world, to think about.
The fate of the world. Right. Okay... She starts backing away.
Oh, man... Milner slumps against a tree, doubling over.  25.
You should be in a hospital. And not the regular kind of hospital.
I just need a mirror. (looks at her) Please. June rifles her purse, hands it to him...
Here. She starts to walk away, but--
Hold this light for me. Milner holds out a pen and June reluctantly takes it. She about to click the top when--
Wait! Don’t touch that. (casually) Just turn the cap. June does and the pen turns into a strangely high-powered flashlight. It illuminates a bloody wound on Milner’s sid
My God, you've been shot.
It happens. June goes gray as Milner sets some supplies next to her p and starts prepping.
It goes all the way through.
Finally, some good news.
I think I’m gonna be sick--
Don't look. As June turns away, she moves: the flashlight completely the wound.  26.

Okay, I’m gonna need you to look. June holds up the mirror and the light so Milner can see. douses the wound with alcohol but it’s June who winces. Milner doesn’t feel a thing. He pierces the skin, sewing himself up.
I don’t think I can do this.
Sure you can, just listen to my voice. June takes a deep breath. He goes to work.
So why were you alone?
None of your business.
Okay. He works some more.
The poem guy didn’t show, huh?
He was late. He got a flat tire.
Really? How'd he do?
You owe him six hundred dollars for the wine.
He get a kiss?
Please stop bringing that up. She looks at Milner as he finishes sewing himself up. He ties off the excess thread with the effortless agility of trained surgeon.
Who are you?  27.
I told you, John Milner.
Okay, what are you?
That I can’t tell you.
Why? Because then you'd have to kill me?

No. Because other people would kill you. And then I'd feel bad. (then) You might want to look away for this next part. She turns away. And Milner uses the opportunity to remove the object, the action figure, from her purse. He slips i into his pocket.

I’ve put you through enough as is. Okay, you can look now. She turns as Milner stands and buttons his stained, blood shirt. He takes out the gun, expertly jacks the clip, and puts it back again. He re-holsters it, looks at her.
Don’t worry, June. You'll never see me again. There’s something sad about the way he says that.
Thanks for your help. And I really am sorry for walking out like that. It was very nice meeting you. Milner turns and walks away. A beat, then June calls afte him-- .
Hey! She approaches and hands Milner some clean bandages.
You should take these. And keep the wound damp.  28.
I thought you had to keep it dry.
I just read that now they think it's better to keep it damp.
They keep changing their minds. One minute they say fried food and cigarettes are bad for you, the next...
Fried food and cigarettes are bad for you.
Huh. Well... (takes the bandages) Thanks. ° Milner walks off. After a few paces, he stops, looks at t bandages in his hand -- damn it. He turns and comes back.
: Listen, you need to know something. a There’s uh, some people gonna come looking for me, which unfortunately means they’re gonna come looking for you, too.
But I don’t know anything--

No, but you were seen with me in the hospital... which, by the way, is why I told you not to take me there. But-- (holds up a hand) Water under the bridge. Important thing for you to know now is that these boys are professionals. If they want to find you, they will. They’1l identify themselves as FBI and tell you some bullshit story about me. It’1ll all sound very convincing, but it’s extremely important that you do not go with them.
Okay, Milner, or whatever you wanna call yourself, why should I believe anything you say? Milner pulls out a badge, barely shows it to her before h puts it back.
Because I'm in the FBI.
You just told me what you did.
They’re gonna kill you anyway. She stands there, doesn’t know what to say.

Now, if you do happen to go with them, and they don’t take you straight to a police station or the local bureau office... If they take you anywhere else -- even if they tell you you’re safe -- it means they're going to kill you.
If they tell me I’m safe--
They're gonna kill you. Now here's the important part: there’1ll probably be a oner in the back.
A what-er?
A piece, a glock, a gat. Probably ad.
(shocked) A gun?
Half the time they forget it’s there. If it’s a Caprice, it’ll be under the seat, between your legs. If it’s a Crown Vic, it’s ina panel in the seat in front of you. Got it?  30.
Don’t got it. Don’t want it. I hate guns.
You’1l hate them less when you really need one. Trust me.
Trust you. Milner starts backing away.
Hey, June? That kiss was really something. Milner then turns and heads off into the night and disappears.
Ackerman and one of his AGENTS examine the elevator housi The door has been kicked off the hinge.
We lost him. Ackerman. sees the trail of blood to the edge, looks down the roof of the garage...
He'd never go to a hospital. I trained him better than that.
Ackerman steps off the elevator, crosses to the admitting desk. Nurse Cheryl looks up as he approaches.
So you’re ready to listen now?

Who brought him in? INT. JUNE’S CONDO - DAWN As the sun rises, we hear June’s ALARM buzz, O.S. INT. JUNE’S BEDROOM - DAWN June awakens groggily, reaches over to the nightstand to off her alarm. Her hand fumbles to find it. It’s not ther
Confused, she sits up to see ACKERMAN holding the alarm c out of her reach. A ROOM FULL OF AGENTS IN SWAT GEAR stand around her bed, pointing guns at her. Ackerman turns off the alarm.
Good morning, Ms. Holyfield. (then) Where is he?
Who?
Milner.
June sits on the couch in shock as Ackerman drops a photograph on the coffee table. June looks uncomfortably the big red headed guy with braces...
This one was from San Diego.
She disappeared on a diving trip... in Thailand. Ackerman drops other photographs in front of June...
This one died in a parachuting accident. Only she wasn’t wearing a parachute. And this one somehow fell off a moving train.
I don’t understand... She looks at the photos, horrified, confused.
The man you helped tonight has been posing as a federal agent in order to lure innocent civilians -- women -- into helping him pull off various national security breaches.
What sort of “breaches?”  32.
I can't go into it other than to say he usually targets women who are, shall we say, vulnerable.
He gets a lot of women over the internet.
(quickly) Well, I don’t do that.
Miss Holyfield. We need you to tell us where he is.
I have no idea. I just met the guy tonight.
Then why did you take him to the hospital?
The man fell on my car. What was I supposed to do, leave him there?
No, you were supposed to call the police.
I tried. Look, I have no idea who he is or where he is. But I’m pretty sure that you’re not allowed to just barge into someone’s house and--
Wake up, Miss Holyfield, this is America. I’m allowed to do whatever is necessary to protect its citizens. Now, did he say anything that could be helpful? '
(beat) We're gonna be dead for longer than we're gonna be alive. The agents look at each other.  33.
He also said that he was an undercover agent on a highly sensitive mission.
And you believed that bullshit?
No, of course not. " She sits there feeling like an idiot now.
Miss Holyfield, you were targeted. That means he’s not going to leave you alone. Which means you now need protection. June hugs herself. Jesus. The news keeps getting worse.
I think the best thing for us to do right now would be to hand you over to the local police, let them keep an eye on you.
June sits in the backseat. “Braces” drives while Ackerman sits shotgun. June looks out the window, shakes her head. She’s broken down.
This is the first time we've ever gotten to a victim before he... you know. He lets that hang. June thinks about that, looks back out the window. :
You’re going to Bombeck station? BRACES . Uh, yeah. ;
Fourth Street’s a better way to go. This will run you into the river-- Ackerman smiles at her.  34.
We know where we're going. But thank you. And don’t worry... You're safe with us.
Excuse me?
You're safe with us. Okay, now she’s worried. The car SWERVES and she looks up as the Driver enters a m highway, out of town.
Where are we going?
Nothing to worry about. Just a short cut. You’re safe with us.
You said that already. He turns around smiles at her.

Because I mean it. June starts breathing heavily. Shit. What to do? Just then, something catches her eye. A placard on the dashboa reads, “CAPRICE.” June thinks for a moment, trying to remember what Milner said. Then she reaches, slowly, quietly, below the seat between her legs. Her hands land on what she’s looking fo June suddenly pulls out the gun. She holds it like it’s o fire, like it’s about to go off in her hands--
(freaking out)
Okay... easy...
Just pull over.
June, please, put the gun down before you accidently-—- Suddenly, the WINDSHIELD SHATTERS.
Hey! - JUNE © I didn’t do that! Now another shot takes out a chunk of the dashboard.
Ma’am, stop shooting!
I’m not shooting! She puts the gun down. Another shot slams into the headre

THAT’S NOT ME! EXT. FURTHER UP THE HIGHWAY - NIGHT © Milner stands in the middle of the street, a HIGH POWERED RIFLE in his- hands, aiming at the oncoming government sedan... Milner HUMS as he shoots, blows out the front ti of ACKERMAN’S car...
In the back of the car freaking out.
Smiles. Adjusts his aim. HUMS... Fires...
As Braces is shot in the shoulder... June screams. Ackerm opens his door and ROLLS OUT OF THE CAR...

As Milner calmly continues to shoot up the car, which now careens out of control, heads right for him, Milner waits blows out another tire sends the car spinning and now ont its side and all the way over onto the roof...  36. He calmly lowers the rifle as the car slides harmlessly p him, sparks flying from metal scraping on asphalt, coming a stop a hundred feet behind him. Milner walks around the flipped vehicle, notes the GAS leaking out onto the pavement.
June? You alive? He crouches down beside the car.
June- hangs upside down by her seat belt. She slowly look him. He smiles, starts. to reach in and unhook her seatbe
Let’s get you out of here. The upside down June looks at him, shakily raises the gun his face. He frowns, easily takes the gun away from her.
C'mon, June. Knock it off. (holds up the gun) Rule number one: you don’t ever point a gun at someone unless you intend to use it. Toldja it would come in handy, though, didn’t I?
(dazed) The gun kept going off... I wasn’t even shooting... I hate guns... She notices gas leaking all around them.
We should hurry.
Don’t worry, that’s not gonna blow up the car. He pulls her out, calmly talking all the while...
I felt terrible about just leaving you like that. I’m walking along, all the time thinking, “I told her about the gun, yeah, but what if she doesn’t know how to use it?”
He helps her to her feet and hurries her over to a black parked nearby.
Anyway, then I thought “I can’t leave her alone with Ackerman. I gotta go back,” but by then, you'd already gotten in the car with them which I expressly told you not to do...
He puts her into the SUV, then glances back at the car, Braces now crawling away from it.
Hang on a sec. He pulls out a gun and FIRES at the gas-drenched vehicle. EXPLODES. June jumps.
That’s how you blow up a car. For a moment, the entire road is lit up and Milner sees Ackerman limping off. June is overwrought. This is all too much for her.
Uh, June? She just stares at him, her eyes start to close. He gentl taps her cheek.
June? She opens her eyes.

Hi. You’re in shock. I want you to stay here in the car while I go have a word with Ackerman. Okay? (pulls his gun) I’m just: gonna go shoot him and come right back. nenpnsey: Milner takes off after Ackerman. June watches him go, wai a moment, then quickly throws open the door, gets out of SUV and takes off running through a field on the side of road.  38.
As June just keeps running into town... she loses a shoe. doesn’t stop to pick it up...
Milner races after Ackerman, limping in the distance. He takes aim at him, when several black sedans SCREECH up be the wounded agent. Milner is outnumbered. He makes a hast retreat.
As a BUS starts to pull away from the curb--
Wait! --stops suddenly as June crosses the street directly in f of it, bangs on the door.
Let me in!

As June gets on, looks behind her to make sure no one saw her. She walks down the aisle to the back ignoring the stares of the other passengers, who take in this crazy-ey woman scratched up, covered in dirt, missing a shoe...
Milner hurries back to the SUV.

Okay, change of plan... He stops, realizing he is talking to no one. EXT. STREET ABOVE JUNE’S CONDO - LATER NOW SWARMING WITH COPS. June’s NEIGHBORS watch from their condos. June steps into FRAME, out of breath, exhausted. She heads for the nearest cop, his back to her. We HEAR THE RADIO IN A SQUAD CAR as she passes...
All units be advised, female suspect, June Louise Holyfield-- June freezes. Looks at the car.

--wanted in connection with the shooting on Highway 2. Suspect is five foot five, twenty-eight years old... June quietly backs away, hurries along to the next block. And now Milner’s SUV quietly pulls up alongside her.
I told you not to leave the car. She keeps walking.
Now you’ve fled the scene. Your prints are all over your gun...
That’s not my gun!
Hey, if you’d trusted me and hung out just another minute or two, I could have helped you clean it up. Now c’mon, get in the car...
I'm not getting in any more cars with anybody.
June-- She stops, turns and looks at him.
Look, I know about the other women. Okay?
What “other women?”
The dead ones. I saw the pictures!
Right. My “victims.” Yeah, that’s one of Ackerman’s favorites. C'mon, June, do I look like a serial killer?  40.
Serial killers never look like serial killers. She starts walking again.
Well, you should know that violence to me is always a last resort.
Nice meeting you, John. Or whatever your real name is.
And the only people I've actually killed-- She stops again. That doesn’t make her feel better.
Okay, let me put it another way, I’ve never killed any women or children. Not that that hasn’t complicated things in the past, but that’s a rule I live by. She just looks at him, frustrated.
Serial killer. Man, I can’t believe you fell for that old chestnut--
(frustrated) Just... what do you want?!
Vamos a la playa!
You want to go to the beach?
I want a fish taco. June resumes walking. He’s insane.
Really, June, I’m starved. We never even ordered dinner...  41.
(indicates the cops down the hill) They're all looking for us and you want to go get Mexican food?
Standard Procedure in this type of situation is to do a Stop-and-Drop.
A Stop-and-Drop.

Throw off the Pursuit Vectoring Protocols by remaining motionless within the Primary Containment Sphere for at least twenty-seven minutes. That'll keep us off the radar long enough to get on the other side of the I.P.W. (off June’s look) Initial Pursuit Window?
Why is it the more you talk, the less I understand you?
It's simple: they think we’re going out, so we’re going in. (then) c'mon, get in the car, June. She thinks a moment, looks back at her condo, finally wal around the SUV, gets in...
(singing) Vamos a la Playa... EXT. “VAMOS A LA PLAYA” TACO JOINT - DAY A cheesy taco joint off the highway. Milner’s SUV sits in the parking lot.
Milner leads June into the restaurant. He spots a SECURIT CAMERA on the wall and leads them to a booth that’s out o the camera's view.
This one’s my favorite booth.
Milner digs into his food. June has no appetite. She just glares at him with her arms crossed.
(eating) What'd I tell you? Good, right? She doesn’t answer.
Feeling better? She still doesn’t answer. Milner stops eating and sits ba
Okay. You have a right to know. Milner reaches into his coat, pulls out his handkerchief, unwraps it to reveal the plastic action figure he dropped into her purse earlier.
This is what it’s all about.
It’s all about a Burger King toy? He breaks off the head on the edge of the table, and we s METALLIC OBJECT inside the action figure. He picks it up.
The fate of the world is in the hands of this little baby-- (accidently drops it into the salsa) --shit-- She watches as he pulls it out, wipes it off with his nap
That's the second time that’s happened--
(impatient) What is it?
It’s a battery.
A battery.

Only not your average Duracell or Eveready. See, someone finally figured out how to convert the water molecule into its component elements -- hydrogen and oxygen. So this battery never runs out. Never ever. Ever. Ever.
That’s it? That’s what this is all about? A battery.

That's it? Man, you’re not very politically savvy are you, June? It’s an infinite source of energy... the kind of thing that could render fossil fuels obsolete. And let’s see, what’s the economy based on...
I understand the implications--
The joke is, they’ve had it for a long time now. Maybe ten years. June stares at the battery as he folds it up in the handkerchief again, puts it back in his pocket.
Too much money still on the table with oil, so they’ve been hiding it until the right time.
Ackerman says you stole it.
He’s right.
So... you did steal it?
From Ackerman. (leans in close) He’s framing me.
But you just admitted you stole it.
That’s right.
So how could he be framing you?
Because, originally, Ackerman and I were sent to protect it, but then one day I find out he’s made a deal to sell it to the highest bidder, so I took the battery and ran.
To protect it.

But for Ackerman to save himself, he’s gotta make me the bad guy. I still can’t believe he did it. I mean, he was my partner. That’s supposed to count for something. Milner looks away, suddenly becoming emotional. He actual starts to get teary, quickly becoming wracked with sobs.
Are you okay?

Yeah, it’s just... I get a little emotional talking about it. I mean, we'd been through a lot together. After that mission in Afghanistan, I thought we really bonded. Hell, I taught him to sand breathe... Milner chokes up again.
Uh...
(collecting himself) Anyway, that’s why everyone's trying to kill me.
Us. Everyone's trying to kill us.
Yeah, well, you were seen with me, so they think you know something.  45.
But I didn’t know anything.
Not then, but you do now.
Because you just told me.
Well, you asked.
No, I didn’t. You said, “Okay, here’s what it’s all about.”
Because you wanted know.
Look, why don’t you just give it back to the government, tell the truth about all of it?

(laughs) Give it back. That’s adorabley June. Tell me, who? Who do I give it back to? I don’t know who to trust. Ackerman clearly had someone on the inside. June shakes her head, looks around the joint.
Right now, I just wanna keep it safe while I figure it all out.
And I wanna go home.

Really? Because... I can’t stop thinking about that kiss. (she turns back to him) I just wonder, if maybe I wasn’t so s busy saving the world, maybe you and I couldn’t spend some time getting to know each other.
I'm... flattered. Which is kind of pathetic, actually. (MORE)
JUNE (cont'd) But, right now, I just really need to go home. Can you understand that?
Completely.
Thank you. In one swift motion, Milner PULLS OUT A HUGE GUN, throws into a STRANGLEHOLD, and drags her out of the booth, to o in plain view of the security camera.
Hey-- what’re you doing?!

head_text.subj: ALRIGHT EVERYBODY DOWN OR I BLOW

text: THIS BITCH’S HEAD OFF!! SCREAMS. Panic. Milner FIRES THREE SHOTS into the air! A light SHATTERS on the floor. Everybody hits the deck. He puts his gun right into June’s cheek. JUNE . Please don’t shoot me! Milner's wild-eyed, crazy.
Don’t make me. Milner fans the gun at the room.
Heads down, I mean it! I see a face, I’m gonna blow it away! Milner drags a petrified June towards the door.
Milner backs out of the door, still holding the gun on Ju
Milner locks the front door of the restaurant then throws keys into the weeds.
What the hell's going on?!
Milner shoves June towards his car, deadly serious--
Get in.
No way! Milner points the gun at her--

You can ride in the front or you can ride in the trunk. It’s your choice. June slides in, latches her seatbelt, and quickly shuts t door. With that, Milner jumps behind the wheel, and hauls ass o of there. — .
Milner drives as June stares forward, panicked. Suddenly, Milner starts laughing--

Man, I wish you could’ve seen the look on your face. “Please don’t shoot me.” Your eyes all buggy-- (then) Put you in the trunk... Like I'd do that. I mean, really, June. I told you I’ve never killed a woman before! June goes for the door handle. He snaps, serious--
I’m sorry. June pulls back her hand.

I had to go crazy back there. It was the only way to get you out of trouble. There were security cameras all over. ‘Now there’s hard proof that you're my hostage. June sits a moment in silence. Not sure if she believes h A beat then--
ospperne.  48.
Why didn’t you tell me?
It had to look real. And it did... He starts laughing again. She SMACKS him hard across the face.
(impressed) Ouch. Good one. He notices something ahead, goes serious.
Ah, here we go: roadblock. Thank God.
You‘re glad? Way up ahead in the distance a ROADBLOCK comes into view, cherries blazing.
Well, now that you’re in the clear, you'll be safe with them.
Like really safe? Or “they're gonna kill me” safe?
Really safe.
What about Ackerman?
He's after me. He just wants the battery. He pulls over, reaches across and opens her door. JUNE . You're really letting me go?
Was nice meeting you, Jtine. And I'm really sorry for any trouble I put you through. She starts to get out.
Have a nice life, June. He looks forward, starts to put the car in gear, but sees something in the rearview mirror.
Uh-oh.
What? Just then, a BLACK OPS HELICOPTER appears out of nowhere.
Stay in the car.
Who are they? The helicopter whips up a tornado of dust.
Shut the door.
What-- aren’t they the cops?
No-— Milner points to the roadblock--
Those are the cops. (pointing to helicopter) These are the bad guys.
The FBI guys?
No. Some other bad guys.
What other bad guys?
Actually, worse guys.
Worse guys?!
Okay, listen to me very carefully and do exactly what I say. Here-- He pulls a MACHINE PISTOL out from under the seat.

I need you to take this gun and start shooting at the helicopter. Just keep shooting until it falls out of the sky or explodes. Either one is good. And put on this vest... He hands her a Kevlar vest which she just stares at.
C’mon, hurry. And, June, this is important: whatever you do, don’t get out of the car. She puts on the vest. Milner throws the car into a 180. The second the car skids to a stop...
June dives out of the car, scrambles to her feet and star to run like crazy. She waves her arms at the helicopter.

Help! I’m not with him! I don’t even know him! I'm innocent! They start shooting at her from the helicopter, riddling ground all around her. June runs back to Milner’s car... INT. MILNER’S CAR - SAME -As June dives in...
I‘m with you! I’m with you! Bullets strafe the roof, but don’t make a dent. This gets her attention.
What did I tell you?
Don’t get out of the car.
And what did you do?  51.
I‘m sorry! I panicked! Milner throws the car into drive and takes off, heading straight for the roadblock. She holds up the gun...
I can’t shoot at anybody!
Sure you can, you just need a little help... Milner leans over and opens the glove box, pulls out a FL
Take a shot of this.
What is it?
Tequila. She knocks back a mouthful from the flask and winces.
I need a lime... June tries to focus as the dashboard opens up and Milner starts going through an array of high tech weapons.

I feel fuzzy-- I mean, funny. She looks at Milner who locks and loads... JUNE . Okay, that wasn’t tequila, was it? She begins to fade in and out of consciousness... EXT. VARIOUS - JUNE’S POV - NIGHT -A MASK is put over June’s pov. -A HELICOPTER catapults towards us out of a giant FIREBAL -MEN WITH GUNS shoot at us, rappelling past the windshiel -Milner yells through his mask, wielding a strange weapon -A POLICE CAR corkscrews through the air, barely missing
As she wakes up. She’s on a cement floor...
Milner, knife in hand, is fighting several people at once He glances at her...
Just a sec, June-- He then takes them all out, moves towards her just as she ‘passes out again and we... CcuT TO BLACK SOUND OF A HELICOPTER OVER...

head_text.subj: FADE IN ON THE INSIDE OF A HELICOPTER

text: It’s crashing. Milner is putting a parachute on June...
We have to hurry! He helps her up...
Jump! And as he PULLS HER out the door, we hear JUNE SCREAM and cut TO BLACK SOUND OF A POWERBOAT...
As June wakes up on the boat, Milner at the helm, as they streak across the open ocean. Milner looks back at her, smiles.
Almost there. CUT TO BLACK. We hear SEAGULLS. WAVES. FADE IN: MILNER’S HIDE-OUT - TROPICAL ISLAND - DAY June blinks, her eyes adjusting as she sits up on her elb  (53.
Sunflares kick off the water as an out-of-focus silhouett emerges from the sea: it’s Milner in SLO-MO, carrying som diving equipment and two huge lobsters, much like the Mat dot-com ad.
Uh, I missed something. She sits up in a hammock beside a hut, wearing a bikini t and a sarong. Milner holds up the two lobsters--
Hey, sleepyhead. I hope you like lobster. June scrambles out of the hammock, stumbles.
You drugged me...
Was for your own good, June. You weren’t really coping all that well and I needed to get us out of there. Milner calmly drops his fins and mask in the sand.
Where are we? What are we doing here?
Hiding out, reloading, relaxing. June realizes what she’s wearing.
Uh, okay, Milner--

C’mon, June. I’ve been trained to dismantle a bomb in the pitch black with nothing but a safety pin and a Junior Mint, I think I can get you in and out of some clothes without looking. (beat) I’m not saying I did that. I’m just saying I could.
He smiles at her and she hits him the face. I mean, reall nails him one, so that he stumbles, drops to one knee. Sh then hurries off down the beach. He touches his jaw, smil
Wow. He watches her run off, impressed.
June storms through the jungle, furious. She ignores the vines and branches that scratch at her and pushes through them to another beach.
Shit. She stands there, looking out a more treacherous stretch coastline. She takes a breath and starts walking.
With the flair of a professional chef, Milner whistles happily as he bastes some fish grilling over coals, then some seasoning. He grates some cheese over some simmering seafood jambalaya.
As June makes her way through the marshy terrain. She sli falls into a puddle of mud up to her waist.
Dammit! Suddenly, a heavy TROPICAL DELUGE slams down on her head. June climbs out of the mud-hole, forcing herself forward.
Milner expertly squeezes out an icing glaze from an icing atop a few fudge truffles, making delicate swirls.

June drags herself along -- soaking wet, exhausted, starv She starts to really panic. It’s getting darker by the minute. She can barely see where she’s going. Like a miracle, she sees something in the distance. She squints into the gloom. Are those torches? She can just make out some kind of structure, built into the hillside.

Summoning her last gasp of energy, June quickens her pace crawling towards the structure, scrambling up the beach.. She suddenly stops dead as she realizes -- this is the pl she left hours ago. Milner stands there, seasoning a simmering pot over a fire.
Big island, huh?
If you're going to kill me, just kill me.
I don’t want to kill you. I just want to finish our date.
June comes out of the bedroom, showered, wearing the saro like a dress... just as Milner takes a machete and chops coconut in half, hands June a cocktail in it.
Here. Very refreshing.
Will it knock me out?
Only if you drink like nine of ‘em. She doesn’t move. He takes a drink. Then passes it to her She takes it, looks around.
So... is this your... hideout?
One of them.
How many places have: you got?
Twelve. No-- eleven, the place in Burma blew up last month. June watches as Milner puts the finishing touches on the exotic meal he’s prepared.  56.
Everything you say seems like such bullshit... I have no clue who you really are.
Part of me being able to do my job is people not knowing who I am.
So am I, like, your hostage?
Not at all. You can leave any time you want. But... He looks at her.
But what?
Why are you in such a hurry to get home?
I have a life. People who depend on me.
The world depends on me. And yet here I am, relaxing. (back to work) Besides, they'll kill you if you go home.
You have the battery. Why would they want to kill me? He sets a plate of beautiful food down in front of her.
I was on the run that night, when I saw you sitting there crying, and I have to say, you really moved me.
You told me this--
I dropped the battery in your purse.  57. She looks at him.
They tracked it.
So they think I’m involved.
Well, you kinda are involved. (off her look) But I’m ‘gonna get you out of it. (then) C'mon, eat...
You’re an FBI agent. Can’t you just talk to somebody--
I never said I was an FBI agent. I said I was in the FBI.
What's the difference?
I had to infiltrate the FBI as part of my mission. The truth is, I work for a much more powerful global organization.
Which one?
The IIA -- International Intelligence Agency.
Never heard of them.
I hope not. If you had, then somebody's not doing their job.
You're telling me you're some kind of super-spy?
Well... super’s kind of braggy, but yeah. (MORE)
MILNER (cont'd) Actually, I’m more like a trouble shooter. They point me at trouble and I--
Shoot it?
I was gonna say fix it, but once in a while, yeah, that’s what I have to do. Come on, your food's getting cold.
She finally takes a bite.
You know I find all this a little a little hard to-- oh my God this is good!
Thank you.
No, really, really good. Like “the best thing I’ve ever tasted” good.
Please, you embarrass me. She eagerly devours her meal as Milner looks on.
So what’s your plan?
No plan.
What kind of secret agent doesn’t have a plan?
The smart kind. A plan is just a road map so the bad guys can find me. * But if I don’t know what’s next, then they don’t either.

That’s ridiculous. You don’t know what you’re doing, so no one else will know what you’re doing? That’s the dumbest thing I’ve ever heard.  59. Suddenly, an ALARM GOES OFF AND ALL OF THE LIGHTS GO OUT.
What’s going on? Milner looks off, sees LIGHTS in the distance.
Huh. How about that? The bad guys found us anyway. Maybe you’re right about the no-plan thing after all.
Milner starts grabbing weapons.
Think you’re ready to fire a gun?
I hate guns.

That’s what I thought you’d say. He puts his hand on the back of her neck and squeezes. Sh passes out at his feet. He looks at her lying there on the floor of the hut. He reaches out to touch her hair, but stops himself.
Jesus, get a hold of yourself, John. He takes a breath, turns towards the lights.
Asleep. She wakes up. We PULL BACK TO REVEAL that we're..
June, confused, looks up to see MILNER.
Great, you’re awake. C'mon. He helps her up.  60.
Milner leads June out the door of a building and leads he down the city street.
(trying to remember) You drugged me again.
Actually, I didn’t drug you. I used a pressure point.

That still counts, I can’t believe you did that again. Didn’t I explicitly tell you not to-- (looks around) What happened to the island? Before them, a flock of pigeons alights to reveal: THE PANTHEON across from them. June stares up at it. . She’s never seen anything like it.
Welcome to Rome.
Oh, my God. She’s in awe. Milner puts his arm around her.
Beautiful, isn’t it?
I've always wanted to--
First time, huh? Always the best. Milner leads her away. She looks around at the various sites. Can't believe her eyes. Can’t believe she’s here.
There’s someone here I can give the battery to.
Who?
Name’s Salvatore Russo. Bigtime environmentalist, philanthropist. (MORE)
—  61. MILNER (cont'd) Brilliant. Squeaky clean. Powerful friends. There’s no way he'd let the battery get into the wrong hands.
You know him?

Never met him before... but he’s going to be at an environmental .summit reception tonight. I thought we’d crash. Then I’m gonna take you to the embassy, get your name cleared. Send you home. She stops cold, looks over his shoulder. Ackerman’s numbe two, the big read head, loiters across the street, preten to look in a shop window. His ARM IS IN.A SLING.
What--
Don’t turn around.
Who is it?
One of Ackerman’s guys... the big Howdy Doody lookalike with braces.
I shot him. Didn’t I?
Well, he’s here.
Just keep walking. Milner ducks into an alley. Presses June up against a wal They wait, up close like this, and a moment later the age walks by, but doesn’t look down the alley...
You're right. That’s him. (looks at June) Nice get, June. They stay close for a moment. Look at each other.  62.
We should probably wait here a few extra minutes, just to be safe.
Yeah. Just to be safe. A nice moment. The nice moment is broken, however, when a GUN is put into Milner’s ear.
Ow.
Holding his gun to Milner’s head.
Small world. Ciao, Milner.
That means “good-bye,” shithead.
Really?
Actually, it’s like aloha, you can say it either coming or going...
(smiles at June) You're full of surprises.
Whatever. You move and it’s aloha to your fuckin brains.

(looks into June’s eyes) I’m happy right where I am. She smiles at him. And suddenly, Braces cries out as she kicks the man hard in the shin. Milner, still looking at June, elbows him in the face and now June kicks him again this time in that higher spot that bends a man over. Milner takes June by the hand and they take off running.
I think aloha can also mean “I love you.”  63.
As Milner and June duck inside. Milner looks out the wind satisfied they're not being followed he turns to June...
Very nice. I’m impressed. But June’s gone. He sees that she’s wandered off, taking the beautiful clothing...
Gianni? June looks over as a pretty young SALESGIRL comes over an embraces Milner.
“Gianni?” They begin conversing in Italian. Milner is fluent and ke up with her. She laughs at a joke he tells, notices a now self-conscious June standing there.
Oh... yeah, I need you to make her even prettier than she is.
Do, I have to?
Yes... and make sure she gets to this address by eight o'clock. June, blown away by Milner’s linguistic skill, watches as scribbles on a card, then hands the girl a BLACK AMEX.
(eyeing June) I'm very jealous, Gianni.
Don't worry-- (kisses the girl on the cheek) It's just business. The Salesgirl nods, “Ah.” June looks hurt -- she’s learne enough Italian to translate Milner’s words: “It’s just business.”
(to the Salesgirl) Grazie. The Salesgirl follows Milner over to June.
Elisa will take good care of you while I go run some errands, get ready for tonight.
Oh...
Pick out whatever you want. I'll see you in a few hours. Milner exits. June looks around the store, overwhelmed. T Salesgirl nods for her to follow... :
A noisy residential neighborhood. Milner gets out of a ta looks up at an apartment building.
Milner climbs the steps, pulls out his gun...
As Milner comes to a door, knocks.
Who is it?
It’s me. The door opens to the limit of the chain and we see THE R HEAD WITH BRACES peering through the crack. Finally--
You're an asshole. He shuts the door, takes off the chain and re-opens it.
First you shoot me, then you kick me in the nuts. What’s up with that?
It was June who kicked you. And she saw you. She’s not stupid... Little uptight maybe, but not stupid. (looks into the apartment) You alone in there?
It’s all clear. Milner puts his gun away, follows Braces inside.
Everything set?
Good to go.
Where’s Ackerman?
At the embassy. What’s up with the girl, really?

What are you doing here?! June whirls around, raises her machine gun. It’s just Milner, doing a voice. He laughs.
Don‘t do that.
Sorry. You know, for a woman who hates guns, you look pretty hot packing one. She hands the machine gun to him.
Where are we?
Don’t worry. We're safe with my peeps.
Your “peeps”? You mean the IIA?
The whats-it? (then, remembering) Ohhh... Actually, I kinda made that up. I’m talking about my real peeps. Come on, I’1l introduce you... He leads her into the adjoining room.
The gathered INTERNATIONAL BUSINESSMEN smile warmly at Mi and June as the two enter.

June, may I present the New Freedom Coalition -- or the NFC, for short. Not to be confused with the National Football Conference, who, for the most part, have no aspirations of global domination. Milner pulls her hand from him, then turns to a SCIENTIST MILNER (CONT’D) This is Dr. Raj. He's reverse- engineering the battery for us. Milner pulls the battery out of his pocket.
(confused) But... you gave me the battery. Milner looks sheepish.
Busted! Sorry, June. That was a fake. I had to get the real one up here ASAP so we could move on to Phase Two.
Phase Two?
Production. He sets the battery down on a table.
We're going to make thousands of them.
And here's the kicker. Once we start the big war in the Middle East and choke off the world’s oil supply -- BAM! -- we appear with the solution. We’re going to be bazillionaires. (then) (MORE )
MILNER. (cont'd) I know that’s not really a number, but when we’re in charge, we’ll make it one.-
I don’t understand.
My dear, it’s very simple. Once we destabilize the global economy, we can use our power to build a better world.
Sure, there might be a little widespread panic and general mayhem. But you can’t make a “free- world frittata” without breaking a few eggs, right? The others chuckle.
Why did you bring me here?
You helped us throw off the FBI, Ackerman, the worse guys, and God- knows-who-else. You’ve proven yourself. We want you in the club. He takes her hands, earnestly. .
I want you in the club. I always knew you were meant for great things. What do you say?
I come all this way around the world to find you -- and this is who you are?
June, think about it. The world is falling apart. We’re offering mankind a second chance. These are the good guys.
No. These are just a bunch of twisted, greedy, evil assholes. And you’re one of them.  100. The other NFC members exchange worried glances.
Milner, do we have a problem here?
(waves them off) We’re cool, we're cool... June, I have to say, you’re being. just a liiiittle bit ungrateful. Think about this. I mean, really think about it.
Screw you.
Milner... Milner sighs wearily.
You disappoint me, June. He pulls a gun and points it at her. She’s defiant.

Go ahead. It’s really been “just business” to you all along, hasn't it? Milner stares her down coldly, his gun steady, his finger tightening on the trigger, when they hear the sound of a ROCKET PROPELLED GRENADE being fired.

(realizing) Ackerman. Get down! A missile hits the room and EXPLODES. All hell breaks loo Everyone’s sent sprawling to the floor as the lights go o debris falls from the ceiling, etc. nm June takes advantage of the distraction. She grabs the battery off the floor and races out the door. Milner notices.
June! He goes after her as a KLAXON blares.  101.
June turns a corner and races down the hallway. Milner ru after her.
June, wait!
Get away from me!

June bursts out onto the huge balcony, built against the mountainside. The view is breathtaking, the drop-off over the railing hundreds of feet to the ground below. . Milner is in pursuit. June heads for a’door across the balcony, but stops short when she sees --

Bursting through the doorway ahead, gun drawn, aiming at Milner. She ducks between two large columns to get out of the lin fire. . Ackerman shoots as Milner dives for cover. Bullets fly in both directions on the balcony before her, the two men engage in a fierce gun battle. She puts the battery in her pocket, desperately looks around for a way out. There are no other exits. She stands there, at a los when -- She hears the sound of a CLANK, CLANK on the floor nearby
Skitters to a stop right before her.

(sees it) Great. June desperately reaches out for the grenade, trying to s protected from the firefight. Her fingers finally land on it. She CHUCKS it towards Milner’s end of the balcony, then d back between the columns as the grenade EXPLODES.
Milner loses his gun in the blast, debris raining down on him. Between the columns, June waits nervously. Ackerman steps before her.
_ Ms. Holyfield?

A bloodied MILNER hits him from the side, knocking Ackerm gun from his hands. The two men tear into each other. June picks up.Ackerman’ gun off the floor, as Milner and Ackerman’s brawl SLAMS t against the balcony’s railing. Damaged by the grenade, th railing gives way. Milner lies half over the side of the balcony, with Acker on top of him, his fingers locked around Milner’s throat. June pulls Milner’s gun from the debris. Milner struggles to free himself from Ackerman’s chokehol then kicks him off, sending him flying across the balcony As the two men stagger to their feet, ready to continue t battle -- :
June steps between them, her arms spread wide, a gun in e hand, aiming at the two men in both directions.
Just... stop.
Easy there, June. You hate guns, remember?
You know what I hate more? Liars!
Ms. Holyfield, I’m here with the FBI. We tracked Milner and the NFC here to shut them down for good.
That’s bullshit, June. He’s not here with the FBI. He’s here with his clients -- the Worse Guys. (MORE)
MILNER (cont'd) They want the battery to power weapons. The kind that can fit in a suitcase. —
So what? You’re with the other bad guys!
No, I’m not! I swear to you! I just infiltrated the NFC as part of my mission.
That’s absurd. Don’t fall for it!
That's why I left you the stamp in your passport. I knew Ackerman and his clients would follow you here. Do you know how hard it is to get all the bad guys in the same place? June is skeptical.
Ms. Holyfield, listen to me. We’ll get you out of here. You can still go back to your old life. For God's sake, don’t let him use you again. . It sounds convincing. June is torn.
June... you know the real reason I chose you when I saw.you in the window of that restaurant? Because you looked lonely. And I know what lonely looks like.
He’s trying to get inside your head. That’s what he does. Don’t ‘let him!
You were wrong, June. What you said when the worse guys drugged you.
Uh... what did I say?  104.
That I could never have anyone in my life. That if we got together, you'd wind up alone.
I said that?
Well, that and you think that we'd have great sex, but let’s stay on target--
I did not say that.
The point is, you’re all I’ve been able to think about, ever since I met you.. You’re the best partner I've ever had, in every conceivable way.
Just-- what do you want, Milner?
I want this first date to go on forever. She looks: him in the eyes a beat -- he’s never looked mo serious. She makes her decision.
(to Milner) I don’t believe you... Milner looks wounded. Ackerman smiles in relief.
(to Milner) ..-but I trust you.
She shoots Ackerman, then goes to Milner. He takes her in his arms, just as -- :

head_text.subj: A GROUP OF ARMED WORSE GUYS

text: Step out onto the balcony. Ackerman, clutching his gunsho wound, calls to them.
(re: Milner and June) Take ‘em out!  105.
Milner...

Don’t worry. I got it. He calmly pulls out a detonation device in his hand. The opposite end of the balcony EXPLODES, and the Worse G go flying. We hear other CHARGES he’s set around the compound GOING when --

Rappel down onto the balcony on.ropes from above and swar from every door, armed to the teeth. They all wear matchi uniforms, emblazoned with a LOGO that resembles the famou shot of the earth rising over the moon. They drag Ackerman and the surviving Worse Guys out of th rubble, swiftly and efficiently disarming them and taking them down. June looks on, amazed.
(realizing) The IIA?
(shrugging) We're the Watchdogs of the World. June smiles, relieved. He kisses her.

You know, I’m glad you decided to trust me before they showed up, because that would have made your choice ridiculously easy. The commando LEADER drops beside Milner and removes his goggles. We recognize him as the Maitre D’ from the restaurant where they first met.
Johnny Milner does it again.
You were supposed to be here at 0800! I had to do it all by myself.  106.
No, it was 0900...
Don‘t you remember the plan?
There was a plan?

June follows Milner into the wrecked room, amazed, as the commandos round up and drag away the last of the bad guys around them -- the New Freedom Coalition, their Guards, a the Worse Guys. Sporadic MACHINE GUN FIRE continues elsewhere in the comp as Milner grabs a bottle of wine and a couple of glasses have miraculously made it through the mayhem. He checks the wine label. Impressed, he pours them both a drink.
(hands her glass) Admit it. This was the best first date you've ever had.
It's up there. They toast and drink.
So -- wanna do it again?
Maybe. Call me. I don’t want to come off desperate. Milner grins.
Oh! I almost forgot... June takes out the battery and hands it to Milner.
Here. Keep it safe.
Yeah, about that... this one’s not real, either.
Then where is the real one?
Nowhere. It hasn’t actually been invented yet.
What?!
I mean, they’re working on it, but it’s still a ways off. But now when it is invented, we will have already taken out all the guys who were going to go after it. See how it works? °
My brain hurts.
You get used to it.
Like in the Mate-dot-com ad. Only now, Milner dives into pool, swims under the water, surfaces to where June waits kisses her...
You know, it may be time for you to meet my mom.
I'd love to. Is she like you? June thinks, then...
Yeah. She is. the and Just then, across the grounds, June hears the ROAR of sev jeeps pull up beside a thatched-roof boathouse.
Uh-oh... A couple DRUG LORD-types and their entourage of armed BODYGUARDS emerge from the jeeps and enter the boathouse.  108.

Time for work. Milner climbs out of the pool, as June reaches into a bea bag and pulls out two enormous MACHINE GUNS. She hands one to Milner, along with some CLIPS. They lock and load as they approach the boathouse. .
What are you making for dinner tonight?
Steak au poivre.
I love steak au poivre!
I know. They share a quick kiss. Milner kicks in the door of the boathouse, as the two burst in, GUNS BLAZING, and we... FADE OUT.
